name: Rebel Guerrillas
background:
Rebel Guerrillas are a diverse band of outcasts and agitators from a variety of alien species. Lacking the heavy weaponry of more organized factions, the Rebel Guerrillas rely on their diverse skills to carry them through.

The Rebel Guerrillas come from many places throughout the galaxy, united together by their opposition to the Inner Sphere, a powerful alliance of civilizations in the galactic core. Unable to confront the Inner Sphere on equal footing, they have been forced into hiding or exile. Some Rebels have now come to the Sirius Sector, looking for resources and allies for what most view as a hopeless struggle.
backgroundFull:
While most see the Inner Sphere as a haven of peace, prosperity, and progress in a galaxy filled with strife, the Rebel Guerrillas define themselves by their opposition to it. The organization traces its origins to the Mandar sector, which fell into civil war and collapse, caused by groups who sought to break away to join the Inner Sphere.

Many within Mandar blamed the Inner Sphere’s ruling Galactic Council for their support and funding of these break away elements. Those who refused to accept the resulting peace and gradual integration into the Inner Sphere formed the Rebel Guerrilla movement, continuing the war even though their former factions had collapsed. These Rebels sought out new allies both within the Inner Sphere and in nearby Sectors, gradually organizing opposition to the Inner Sphere into a broad coalition.

Few in number and unable to challenge the Galactic Council on equal terms, the Guerrilla’s have scattered themselves throughout the galaxy, as their hidden cells work tirelessly to undermine the Council’s influence wherever possible. Their membership draws on a mix of those disaffected by life within the Inner Sphere, and daring adventurers and mercenaries who seek to challenge the most powerful organization in known space. While lacking the infrastructure and organization of more traditional factions, the Guerrilla’s are able to draw on a variety of species, tactics, and technology from throughout the galaxy.

For those in the Sirius Sector, the conflict between the Rebel Guerrillas and Galactic Council is a remote one, which they hold little stake in. However, the Guerrilla’s sophisticated technologies from Mandar and the Inner Sphere have attracted the attention of a number of factions in Sirius. The Guerrillas have no interest in overthrowing the local regimes, but have been known to get involved with local conflicts when they feel it necessary. Sometimes, they may serve as mercenaries and allies to local factions when their interests align, whilst at other times they may steal tech or help potential recruits defect or escape prison. The Guerrillas try to avoid escalating these conflicts, and as a result many within the Sirius Sector do not realize the true scale of their organization.

How will you challenge the greatest power in the galaxy?

spells.name: Aura of Peace
spells.effect: Pick one friendly unit within 12", which gets +1 to morale test rolls once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: params.thisUnit ? this.getMoraleCost({ ...unit, quality: Math.max(1, unit.quality - params.effect.rollModifier.value) }) - this.getMoraleCost(unit) : 0

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: params.thisUnit ? 0 : this.getMoraleCost({ quality: 5 - params.effect.rollModifier.value }) - this.getMoraleCost({ quality: 5 })

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Mind Breaker
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 12", which takes 2 hits with AP(1) and Surge. Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

parameters.name: spellHitRoll
parameters.value: Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

spellHitRoll.name: Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

spells.name: Bad Omen
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy units within 18", which friendly units gets Furious against once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (this._skirmish ? 1 : this.AuraSize), avgUnit: true }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Wave of Discord
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 18", which takes 2 hits with Thrash.

spells.name: Deep Meditation
spells.effect: Pick up to three friendly units within 12", which get +1 to hit rolls when shooting once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)
once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Piercing Pulse
spells.effect: Pick one enemy model within 24", which takes 3 hits with AP(4).

specialRules.name: Fortified
specialRules.description: When units where all models have this rule take hits, those hits count as having AP(-1), to a min. of AP(0).

specialRules.name: Precise
specialRules.description: Gets +1 to hit when attacking.

specialRules.name: Counter-Attack
specialRules.description: Strikes first when charged.

specialRules.name: Guerrilla
specialRules.description: Once per round, units where all models have this rule may move by up to 3" after shooting or being in melee.

specialRules.name: Takedown Strike
specialRules.description: Once per game, when it's this model's turn to attack in melee, you may pick one model in the unit as its target, and make one attack at Quality 2+ with AP(2) and Deadly(3), which is resolved as if it's a unit of 1.

specialRules.name: Piercing Tag
specialRules.description: Once per game, during this model's activation, pick one enemy unit within 36" and in line of sight of it, and place X markers on it. When attacking, friendly units may remove markers from their target before rolling to block to get +AP(Y), where Y is the number of removed markers.

specialRules.name: Surprise Piercing Shot
specialRules.description: Counts as having Ambush, and gets AP(+2) when shooting on the round in which it deploys via this rule.

specialRules.name: Courage Buff
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick one friendly unit within 12", which gets +1 to morale test rolls once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Strider Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Strider.

specialRules.name: Rending in Melee Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Rending in melee.

specialRules.name: Regeneration Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Regeneration.

specialRules.name: Bane when Shooting Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Bane when shooting.

specialRules.name: Bane in Melee
specialRules.description: This model gets Bane in melee.

specialRules.name: Thrash
specialRules.description: Against units where most models have Defense 5+ to Defense 6+, this weapon gets Blast(+3).

specialRules.name: Guerrilla Boost Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Guerrilla Boost.

specialRules.name: Furious Mark
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick one enemy unit within 18", which friendly units gets Furious against once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Deadly
specialRules.description: Assign each wound to one model, and multiply it by X. Hits from Deadly must be resolved first, and these wounds don’t carry over to other models if the original target is killed.

specialRules.name: Ambush
specialRules.description: May be set aside before deployment. At the start of any round after the first, may be deployed anywhere over 9” away from enemy units. Players alternate in placing Ambush units, starting with the player that activates next. Units that deploy via Ambush can’t seize or contest objectives on the round they deploy.

specialRules.name: Strider
specialRules.description: May ignore the effects of difficult terrain when moving.

specialRules.name: Rending
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and on unmodified results of 6 to hit, those hits get AP(+4).

specialRules.name: Regeneration
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 5+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Bane
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and when attacking the target must re-roll unmodified Defense results of 6.

specialRules.name: Defense
specialRules.description: This model gets +X to defense rolls.

specialRules.name: Blast
specialRules.description: Ignores cover, and after resolving other special rules, each hit is multiplied by X, where X is up to as many hits as models in the target unit.

specialRules.name: Guerrilla Boost
specialRules.description: If most models in this unit have Guerrilla, they may move by up to 6" from Guerrilla (instead of only 3").

specialRules.name: Furious
specialRules.description: When charging, unmodified results of 6 to hit in melee deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Surge
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 6 to hit, this weapon deals 1 extra hits (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).
